result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling or a combination of both equal to fulltime as able and as agent recommends.
Participate and comply with any recommended psychological assessments and psycho sexual evaluation deemed appropriate by the agent.

No contact with minors without prior agent approval.
Any internet usage has to be determined and approved by the agent in advance.
Do not go on any pornographic websites or chatrooms.

Comply with the Sex Offender Registry requirement.
Comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations.
Comply with any recommended treatment from these evaluations.
Take any medication as recommended by physician.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by an assessment and the agent.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacies and treatment.  
Provide DNA sample.
Pay $500 surcharge as defined in 973.042(2) for the images of child pornography.
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S. Goligoski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on October 21, 2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:10 pm  Court calls the case.  Atty Constable states the appearances.

Court has received the Department of Corrections Pre-Sentence Investigation and alternative pre-sentence investigation report by Defendant.
Atty Constable has received the documents and does not have any corrections.
Atty Dalkert has received the documents and notes one correction.

Atty Constable makes arguments to the Court re: sentencing recommendations.
Atty Dalkert makes arguments to the Court re: sentencing recommendations.

BY THE COURT:

Count 1:
Prison Sentence 10 years - 4 years initial confinement and 6 years extended supervision
Conditions of supervision:
Comply with the Sex Offender Registry requirement.
No contact with minors without prior agent approval.
Any internet usage has to be determined and approved by the agent in advance.
Do not go on any pornographic websites or chatrooms.
Comply with any sex offender treatment recommendations.
Participate and comply with any recommended psychological assessments and psycho sexual evaluation deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with any recommended treatment from these evaluations.
Take any medication as recommended by physician.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by an assessment and the agent.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacies and treatment.
Pay costs, including DNA surcharge.      
Provide DNA sample.
Pay $500 surcharge as defined in 973.042(2) for the images of child pornography.
Obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling or a combination of both equal to fulltime as able and as agent recommends.
1 day jail credit.
Fines and costs to come out of any bond posted, and the remainer to be returned to the poster.  If money owed after, money will be taken out at 50% of prison wages.

Count 2:
Same sentence, concurrent to Count 1.

Atty Constable makes statements to the Court re: new law increasing the amount from prison wages from 25% to 50%.
Atty Dalkert makes statements to the Court re: requesting time to research the law.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order 50% of prison wages until he hears otherwise from Atty Dalkert and would then reduce it to 25%.
Court provides a written determination of prison sentence to Defendant.
Atty Dalkert to provide information and the appeals right form to Defendant.
Court does not find Defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or Substance Abuse program.

2:55 pm  Case concluded.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant eventually arrived for plea hearing.
Sentencing hearing on October 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:46 PM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.
Matter was set for a plea hearing today.
Case was adjourned one time about a month ago to accommate the Defendant.

State requests Warrant, Body Only.

Atty Dalkert addresses the Court, Defendant was in her office this morning, is prepared to go forward today.
Atty Dalkert was just on the phone with Defendant and Defendant stated that he is on his way.

BY THE COURT:
It is 2:49 PM and it was set for 2:30 PM.
Defendant failed to appear.
Court will authorize a criminal warrant for arrest, body only.

2:51 PM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.
Defendant now appears with Atty Dalkert.
Atty Constable appears for the State.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 2.
State moves to dismiss and read in Counts 3 and 4 and 5.
State requests a PSI.
State will cap its recommendation.

Atty Dalkert concurs, Defense is free to argue.
3 year mandatory minimum is addressed.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1 and Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Dalkert for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Possession of child pornography
Count 2: Possession of child pornography
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
Count 5: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI be completed and provided to the parties at least one week prior to the hearing.

State moves the Court to revoke the Defendant's bond.
Atty Dalkert requests the Court to not revoke the bond.
State addresses the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court will deny motion to revoke bond and expect Defendant to be fully cooperative with the PSI investigation.
Plea hearing on August 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

10:35 a.m. Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Dalkert request matter be adjourned and states reasons to the Court.  Court grants adjournment and matter is rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:50 AM Court calls case.
Matter is before the Court on Defendant's motion for clarification for specific statute.

Atty Constable states appearances.

Court has received the Defendant's motion and brief in support of the motion.

Atty Dalkert addresses the Court. 939.617(2)  The word "or" is extremely significant for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, apologizes for being late coming to Court. Atty Constable was unable to prepare written response.

Atty Dalkert addresses the Court, replies. 

Court addresses Atty Dalkert regarding the word "or".
Atty Dalkert replies.

Court and Atty Dalkert continue discussions.

Court makes findings for the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court clarifies minimum mandatory sentence applies. 

Atty Dalkert addresses the Court regarding appellate court.  

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

12:09 PM Court is in recess.







  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
in Support of Defense's Motion to the Court to Clarify State 939.617
Defendant's Notice of Motion for the Court to Clarify if Wis State 939.617 Requires a Minimum Period of Incarceration

State files information.
Atty Dalkert received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Pleas are accepted.

BY THE COURT:
Bonds are ordered continued.

Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:38 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Special Agent L. Glaman is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Constable. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Dalkert. 
3:56 PM (Clerk is now A.Z.)
4:03 PM Witness is exused.

Court finds probable cause that crimes have been committed by Defendant, bind over for trial.

Parties are ready to proceed to arraignment today.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No contact with minors females.  Not to use computers or electronic devices for internet or downloading videos.

7/31/15: Bond conditions are modified to: 
Court will allow contact with minors if it is trivial and incidental. 
Court will allow contact with the niece provided a parent of the niece is supervising.  
Court will allow computer access at MSTC for taking the GED test under supervision of the Proctor.

Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:56 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Dalkert makes arguments in support of the motion to modify bond conditions. 
Atty Constable makes arguments re: the motion.  
Atty Dalkert makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will allow contact with minors if it is trivial and incidental. 

Atty Dalkert makes statements re: discussion with her client about incidential contact. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will allow contact with the niece provided a parent of the niece is supervising.  Court will allow computer access at MSTC for taking the GED test under supervision of the Proctor.   Court does not feel that limiting access to study.com is enforceable.  Court is not aware of a way to prevent the defendant from accessing other websites. 

Court questions Atty Dalkert. 
Atty Dalkert responds. 

BY THE COURT: Court will not allow access to study.com.

Defendant Nicholas S. Goligoski in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Atty Dalkert requests modification to bond. No objections as stated on the record. Court requests modification be put on a stipulation for the Judge to sign.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$2,500 cash bond: No contact with minors females.  Not to use computers or electronic devices for internet or downloading videos.

To be heard at 10:45 a.m.
DA #15PT1409
d.o.b. 02-29-1992
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Child Pornography.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,500 cash bond  

BTC: $2,500 cash bond: No contact with minors females.  Not to use computers or electronic devices for internet or downloading videos.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  07-27-2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
